reviews.text: This is straight opposite the railway station (although could be better signposted...but hang in there, it's obvious when you get near it)
reviews.title: Good value, very clean & ideal for its purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night to see the main sights of Dresden, and it was ideal for this as we arrived and left on the train. It's clean, reasonably well equipped and staff were helpful. They also included a useful free 1-day tram pass, so getting the the main sites on the river was very simple. Our room faced the railway, but I did not notice any particular noise, although a lot of trains pass through.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: This is not a spot for a romantic weekend. It's simple and functional. But it would stay again.
reviews.title: Best hotel on our 3 hotel tour

reviews.text: We are going to leave a review in English because we can't see very many! We stayed here in December 2010. This hotel is located directly across from the main train station and within walking distance of all the major sites. Unfortunately we were snowed under at the time but there was no better place to spend this time than at the Intercity. The room was very comfortable and spacious. We were at the front of the hotel but heard nothing. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful as were the bar and restaurant staff. Our only criticism was that the restaurant could have had more staff working as the poor waitress working on our first night was run off her feet. Food was a little bit more expensive than what we had bargained for but was tasty. A nice touch in this hotel is that they give you a day pass for the public transport system. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Across from Central Station and easy access to the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice new hotel well located for the DB station (<2 mins away) and trams to centre. Trams take about 5 mins to reach centre so if you wanted to be central to this then hotel location may not be the best possible (trams are modern, easy and regular though).
reviews.title: Nice - but the beds are skinny

reviews.text: I was not looking to be impressed with InterCity Hotel, and they do not try. They work on what they offer, and do what they do well. It is simple, close to the train station (right across the street), and offered all the energy I needed for the day at breakfast. The bathroom was tiny, the bed comfortable, and a couple of the staff and I had difficulty with German/English conversations. Basic questions in English posed a challenge which surprised me, but I realize I am spoiled with how well-versed the world is with English (and how I am not with other languages). The one thing that really annoyed me was that the hotel said that it was sound-proof: well, I could hear the trains softly come in/out; however, the skate-boarders that make the outside cement area their skate-park at dusk to late at night can easily be heard so the windows are certainly not sound-proof. Oh, and, I loved Dresden and could have stayed even another 2 nights. What a fabulous city.
reviews.title: For price, satisfied, but not overly impressed.

reviews.text: Not an overly fancy hotel, but very new and nice inside. All very clean, well kept and the staff are nice. Location is great, by the main station at the edge of the Altstadt, so most things are 15 mins walk, but they give you a free transport ticket for anything further.
reviews.title: Good value, convenient & new

reviews.text: The rooms are nice and a comfortable size for a few nights stay, but not huge. Good for the price you normally pay, but if you want something fancier there are more expensive options in the Altstadt itself.
reviews.title: dresden

reviews.title: Get the HalfBoard!

reviews.text: The InterCity Hotel is located directly across from the main train station in Dresden. Arriving from the airport is incredibly easy. Before you exit the airport, you will see a sign that reads "S." This sign indicates how to get to the S-bahn. Go down to the lower level and you will find the train platform. Only 1 train so you can't end up lost. Buy your ticket from the ticket machine for 2 Euro. Make sure you also stamp the ticket. There will be a inspector on-board the train to make sure you purchased a ticket. Get off at the stop "Dresden Hauptbahnhof" which is the main station, go down the escalator, look for the sign for Pragger Strasse, cross the street/tram tracks and look to your left and you will see the hotel. You will appreciate the location if it is raining or you have a ton of luggage.
reviews.title: Good location.

reviews.text: I would have given this hotel a 5-star if either free Wifi or free breakfast was included. The Wifi is a little pricey and breakfast is 15 Euro.
reviews.title: Nice...Once You Find It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For breakfast I went over to the train station and ate at the Marche Restaurant. The breakfast buffet is 13.90 Euro and is incredibly sumptuous. Tell the cashier you would like Wifi and she will give you a small slip of paper with the ID and password - free Internet for 1 hour. The restaurant is very nice. You can also purchase other meals along with breads and rolls to take away.
reviews.title: This has all you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pretty much everything is within walking distance from the hotel. The hotel does give you a transit pass which is good on the S-bahn, trams and buses. Get on a tram and ride to end of any line - sort of like a mini sightseeing tour to see what the neighborhoods are like. You can use this transit pass to return to the airport so you don't have to buy a 2 Euro return ticket.
reviews.title: Always a good choice
